did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: James J. John papers, circa 1930-2016, bulk 1970-2010.
did.physdesc: Research material, photographs, publications, audio recordings
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Materials relating to the career of Professor James John. Items relate to medieval studies including intellectual history and universities, theology, Latin paleography, historiography, Preand#x301;montreand#x301;. Course materials including, lectures, notes, syllabi, exams, and annotated publications for his courses in the Department of History including courses on the Middle Ages, medieval culture 400-1300 and paleography. Files relating to History 263, 264, 365, 366, 501, and 665. Publications owned by or relating to Harry Caplan, Dorothy Schullian, John J. Waldemer. Many slides and images of medieval and other manuscripts some of which have been digitized. Materials from and relating to E. A. (Elias Avery) Lowe including a set of glass lantern slides of medieval manuscripts belonging to Lowe, correspondence, publications, transcriptions of manuscripts, biographical material.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: James John is a Cornell University professor emeritus, where he taught medieval intellectual history; historiography; universities; Latin paleography in the Department of History.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to the career of Professor James John. Items relate to medieval studies including intellectual history and universities, theology, Latin paleography, historiography, Preand#x301;montreand#x301;. Course materials including, lectures, notes, syllabi, exams, and annotated publications for his courses in the Department of History including courses on the Middle Ages, medieval culture 400-1300 and paleography. Files relating to History 263, 264, 365, 366, 501, and 665. Publications owned by or relating to Harry Caplan, Dorothy Schullian, John J. Waldemer. Many slides and images of medieval and other manuscripts some of which have been digitized. Materials from and relating to E. A. (Elias Avery) Lowe including a set of glass lantern slides of medieval manuscripts belonging to Lowe, correspondence, publications, transcriptions of manuscripts, biographical material.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: James J. John papers, #14-17-4295. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Dorothy Schullian material located in collection #4131, Dorothy May Schullian papers.
